title: Brown Sugar Ham Steak Recipe
description: This ham steak recipe is sweet and savory and cooks in minutes. You'll need just three ingredients, and it pairs beautifully with any number of sides.

Pairs great with roasted potatoes and green beans. Submitted by CassieB Updated on May 2, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 32 32 32 32 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 1 (8 ounce) bone-in fully cooked ham steak 5 tablespoons butter, cubed 5 tablespoons brown sugar Directions Gather the ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook ham steak in a large skillet over medium heat until browned, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Remove ham from skillet; drain off any fat. Melt butter in the same skillet over medium-low heat. Stir in brown sugar. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Return ham to skillet. Cook, turning ham often, until heated through and brown sugar has dissolved, about 10 minutes. Reduce heat if brown sugar/butter mixture starts to pop or splatter. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 519 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Brown Sugar Ham Steak 01 of 32 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 32 Photo by  DREGINEK 07/30/2023 My first making a ham steak ever! Yes, I could imagine what this would taste like; the flavor profile is familiar- but! It was better than I expected - plus super easy and super quick. I added a sliced onion when I added the butter; I like more savory to offset the sweet brown sugar. We really liked this! Thanks CassieB! 03 of 32 Photo by  Sheli Creek 12/29/2022 Yum! 04 of 32 Photo by  Robin 04/04/2021 It turned out delicious. My husband really likes it. I like it too. Found it so easy and so good. I will be making this again. 05 of 32 Photo by  Chris 08/08/2020 I make this and freeze it for a quick meal when you don’t have time to cook. 06 of 32 Photo by  Nicholas DeRoy 07/18/2020 07 of 32 Photo by  Amy 06/02/2020 08 of 32 Photo by  bmackisey 05/21/2020 Wonderful!!!! Used as a marinade while grilling a ham steak - yummm! 09 of 32 Photo by  Jennifer Goldschmidt 04/12/2020 Loved this recipe. Seasoned the ham steak with salt, pepper and garlic powder. Let sit in the fridge for a couple hours. Cooked and cast iron skillet. Added a pinch of ginger and nutmeg. Put in oven for five minutes on each side. Came out perfect! 10 of 32 Photo by  Kolleen MacNabb 09/27/2019 I had ham steak in the freezer and didn't know what to do with it so here I am. This recipe wasn't bad, the flavor was good. I did add honey and boiled the ham in the glaze.
